ygData.subject: Re: AE spells
ygData.msgSnippet: actually you re wrong. Icestrike is a good example. if you cast icestrike on yourself, EVERYONE around you will be hurt, including -PvP peopple ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
actually you're wrong. Icestrike is a good example. if you cast icestrike on
yourself, EVERYONE around you will be hurt, including
-PvP peopple


-----Original Message-----
From: shypht <evanschu@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Saturday, May 22, 1999 3:20 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] AE spells


>From: "shypht" <evanschu@...>
>
>If you are a non-PvP server and all -PvP, you do not need to worry about
>hurting other party members.
>BUT, using AE spells is dangerous anyways, if you cast it on a mob that has
>no hate for the tanks yet,
>you are bound to get them onto you.
>
>But, as for the use of AE spells and how they are good.
>
>- Lets take the lvl 24 Column of Lightning spell, 130 mana, does 130 damage
>to the mobs around it.
>- Lets say there are 2 mobs, you cast that, for the cost of 130 mana you do
>260 damage(130 per mob).
>
>That is nice damage / mana ratio no? .. but you need to make sure your
tanks
>are building up hate on all the monsters before you start to use AE spells.
>I just like to stick to my lower lvl DD spells when in groups.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: MAD Iguana <wargod@...>
>To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
>Date: Saturday, May 22, 1999 6:00 PM
>Subject: [eq_wizards] AE spells
>
>
>>From: MAD Iguana <wargod@...>
>>
>>I really don't see how AE spells are useful at all. The only way I can
see
>>it being useful is if I root a group of mobs close together, but how often
>>does that happen? If i am in a party and the tanks are fighting a group
of
>>mobs, the AE spell will hit my party members too so what is the point?
Can
>>anyone enlighten me here, maybe I am missing something. Thanks.
>>
>>
